intro: Tetrapterys viburnifolia, commonly known as the Mexican elderberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with four pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red or orange berries. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
